attributes.action: Include posthumously those who worked at Bletchley Park and have since deceased, in the proposed issue of a Service Medal to honour and recognise their contribution to the War Effort in WW2, and that such medals be presented to their surviving spouse or children.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As one of many children of former (and now deceased) Bletchley Park workers in WW2, I have always been concious of the pride in which my mother and other relations held thier contribution to the War Effort and the trust that was put in them at the time. To the day my mother died in 1993 she never spoke in any detail of her work as she considered herself to still be under the obligation of secrecy that she signed up to in 1940. As members of her family we, like perhaps many others, carried that pride with us on her behalf and continue to do so today.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
